utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brings you in here today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, hi, I'm so I have been very wheezy for the past week um and I'm also like consistently coughing all the time and it's not getting any better. Um I do have asthma and I think it's it's acting up.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how long have you had asthma for?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Since I was like 5.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and are you using any puffers?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes, so I am on a short acting. As well as an inhaled cortico steroid. And I only take the short acting like when I have the symptoms

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And so how how long have you been symptoms worsening for?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: For the past week I would say.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how how often have you used the ventilin?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: The ventilin that I use is almost every day like a couple times a day.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so would you say more than 10 times?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you had to do you have y to miss any school or anything like that over the past week?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I missed two days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Two days, OK. And are you just getting daytime symptoms or are you waking up from sleep or not being able to sleep because of your symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I woke up twice last week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK, so yeah, definitely seems like your symptoms are really acting upon and so you're getting some wheezing and you say you're also getting a cough.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes, that's right,

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And what kind of things would you be doing that you get these symptoms? Is it mostly exertion or is it exposure to dust or any other environmental factors?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, but, it's mostly exertion, but things like cold air can trigger it too.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, I see. OK, any have you been exposed to any new environments where there is, you know, dusty carpets, mold, new animals, anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK, and how would you describe the cough? Is it wet or dry?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's dry.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and. And how about the wheezing? Are you getting it like frequently every time you have an episode, or just sometimes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I I'm getting an on and off, but basically every time I cough after that I'll be wheezy for a little bit.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK, and are you having any other symptoms like sore throat, runny nose, shortness of breath, anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and any blood in your sputum at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no blood.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK and has the ventilin been helping at all? Or do you find that it's less effective?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Ventilin um it's been helping temporarily, but it definitely doesn't help as much as it used to.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um. And have you traveled at all recently or been in touch with anyone who's been sick?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, no, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And, and any headaches? Nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: He no, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Nothing like that OK, any dizziness or fainting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No OK, any fevers or chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No. Any fatigue?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um a little bit because I haven't been sleeping too well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any? Sensation of chest pain or racing of your heart?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No. OK. Any changes in your bowel movements?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any changes in your appetite or weight?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, any changes in your sense of smell or taste?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK. An other than asthma since you were five an do you have any other medical conditions at all?. OK, do you take so you take the ventilin and then do you take the inhaled cortico steroid puffer as well?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I do.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and you take that daily?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um yes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any other medications that you take?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, just some multi vitamins. That's about it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any allergies to any medications that you know?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not to medication I’m allergic to like strawberries and Kiwis.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and what kind of reaction do you get?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I just break out in hives.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you been previously hospitalized for any reason?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any past surgeries?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Ah nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and currently like who do you live with?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I love with both my parents and two of my siblings.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and are any of them sick at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No everyones pretty healthy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And. So currently right now you're 16. This is an age where sometimes your peers or yourself might experiment with alcohol, smoking or recreational drugs. Have you have you tried anything at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven’t.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Do you have any friends or peers that have tried alcohol or recreational drugs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and in terms of just your home environment school. Do you feel safe or do you find yourself feeling unsafe or having been bullied at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh, I'm pretty, I feel pretty safe.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, that's good. And any family history of any heart or lung conditions at all ?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No. OK, so yeah, those are all the questions I had for you today. Do you have any questions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, So what can I do about These these symptoms? Should I continue taking my puffers?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, So what we'll have to do is re assess. So right now we will need to alleviate some of your symptoms so we will get you get you some ventilin and you mate will do like a full physical examination and get your oxygen saturation and everything an you might need some cortico  steroids as well and then we'll talk about changing your regiment for your puffers as well and whether or not we need to add something else into your therapy, so we'll do a full physical examination and then go on from there. Does that sound good?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, that sounds great. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
